vulnerability_information:
Hello,

**Summary:**
Normally If user __(victim)__ set to private / protect their tweets in setting Tweet privacy, other people/user will not able to see their recent or their pass status/twits when they visit his/her __(victim)__ profile. people only can see their __(victim)__ profile images and information about __how many tweet already post by that user__ , __how many followers and following by that account__ and __how many likes__ etc etc. but i found a way to view the protected tweets from other user who protect their tweets.


**Description:** 
in your policy i see there is new domain add as in scope target , and the domain is `niche.co` .
there is some condition needed to success reproduce this vulnerability:
1. the __victim__ need to connect their twitter account with `niche.co`
2. use the `niche.co` API to Access the Protected Tweets

## Steps To Reproduce:
_victim side_
 * victim account is `https://twitter.com/dummysystems`
  * lets say the victim already set to protect his/her tweets via `https://twitter.com/settings/safety`
{F225673}
  * now when other user try to visit victim profile it will look like this
{F225670}
  * now visit `https://www.niche.co/get-started` and chose twitter , allow and or Authorize Niche to use your account and complete the rest (including confirming your email address).

_attacker side_
  1. attacker no need to have twitter account and or no need to have `Niche` account here , this made the severity is high
  1. just visit `https://www.niche.co/api/v1/users/[victim_twitter_account]` ( in this case the victim is https://www.niche.co/api/v1/users/dummysystems , the attacker will show some important information disclosure regarding the victim account
   {F225668}
  1. scroll down the page till you see something like this `/users/52667/posts?accounts=162059`
  {F225669}
  1. and open it, so the full URI will become `https://www.niche.co/api/v1//users/52667/posts?accounts=162059`
  1. and BOOM! the attacker now have Access to Protected Tweets from victim account.
{F225671}
{F225672}

**noted**
to follow the rules, I use my own account as the __victim__, so there is no other / real account has been compromised.


Regards,
title: Unauthorized Access to Protected Tweets via niche.co API

activities.message:
Hello @twitter 

i have an update here, after do more analysis i found another END POINT that can be used to view the private/protected tweets from victim account.

* so there is 2 END POINT that can be use to expose the protected tweets from victim
  1. `https://www.niche.co/api/v1//users/[user_id]/posts?accounts=identity_id`
  1. `https://www.niche.co/api/v1/identities/[identity_id]/posts/`

* the user_id & identity_id is easy to get via 
 `https://www.niche.co/api/v1/users/[victim_twitter_username]`
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @twitter

i have an update here, after do more analysis i found another END POINT that can be used to view the private/protected tweets from victim account.

  • so there is 2 END POINT that can be use to expose the protected tweets from victim

    1. https://www.niche.co/api/v1//users/[user_id]/posts?accounts=identity_id
    2. https://www.niche.co/api/v1/identities/[identity_id]/posts/

  • the user_id & identity_id is easy to get via
    https://www.niche.co/api/v1/users/[victim_twitter_username]

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message:
Hello sir @mli and @twitter team,

I just check this again today , both of the end point now give zero data (no more show the content of protected tweets)
{F228941}
and the following URL `https://www.niche.co/api/v1/identities/162059/` now give a notice __invalidated_reason	"Account privacy is set to protected."__ in the response.
{F228942}

So i confirm this issue / vulnerability has been fix. Congrats and Great job.

Regards,
activities.markdown_message:
Hello sir @mli and @twitter team,

I just check this again today , both of the end point now give zero data (no more show the content of protected tweets)

and the following URL https://www.niche.co/api/v1/identities/162059/ now give a notice invalidated_reason "Account privacy is set to protected." in the response.

So i confirm this issue / vulnerability has been fix. Congrats and Great job.

Regards,

activities.message:
We consider this issue to be fixed now.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

Hello sir @andrewsorensen

activities.message:
Hello sir @andrewsorensen and @twitter team,

this one is similar to this #97161 report, but there is some point that make this report have a higher severity/impact 

* this #97161 report need to have an account and or login first to success exploited or reproduce  the vulnerability , this one (my report) no need to have account.
* this #97161 report is only can view per word and if the word is available in the protected tweet from victim, but on this one (my report) can show all protected tweet even from first tweets from victim.

Regards,
activities.markdown_message:

this one is similar to this #97161 report, but there is some point that make this report have a higher severity/impact

  • this #97161 report need to have an account and or login first to success exploited or reproduce the vulnerability , this one (my report) no need to have account.
  • this #97161 report is only can view per word and if the word is available in the protected tweet from victim, but on this one (my report) can show all protected tweet even from first tweets from victim.

Regards,

activities.message:
We'll review this issue as part of our weekly report review, but please keep in mind that Niche is not in scope for bounty per our [program rules](https://hackerone.com/twitter).

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security!
activities.markdown_message:
We'll review this issue as part of our weekly report review, but please keep in mind that Niche is not in scope for bounty per our program rules.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security!

activities.message:
Hello sir @andrewsorensen 

First, thanks for your reply..i know the niche is in scope target but not in scope for bounty..but the impact is effect to the twitter it self (about tweeting).i think we agree even from other component that can break the privacy setting (in this case is able to read or access protected tweets) is a dangerous and have high severity. Because its effect to the privacy from twitter user.

Regards,

activities.message: Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. Unfortunately, this report does not fall in scope for a monetary reward at this time. However, you will still be listed in our Hall of Fame. Thanks again.

activities.message:
Hello @Twitter

I am disappointed , this one is not eligible. even the fact this similar to this #97161 report but have a higher impact than that one like I have mentioned in my previous comment.

in your policy say `High impact vulnerabilities will be considered on a case by case basis.` and  __privacy violation__ like this is high/critical I guess.

 if this is the final decision , should I ask for mediation or we can just public disclosure this ?

regards,

activities.message:
TweetDeck is a in-scope Twitter property listed on our program rules. Niche is clearly listed as being ineligible for bounty, and upon further review the payouts panel ruled that this report should be marked as ineligible.

Thanks for helping keep Twitter secure!

vulnerability_information_html:
Hello,

Summary:
Normally If user (victim) set to private / protect their tweets in setting Tweet privacy, other people/user will not able to see their recent or their pass status/twits when they visit his/her (victim) profile. people only can see their (victim) profile images and information about how many tweet already post by that user , how many followers and following by that account and how many likes etc etc. but i found a way to view the protected tweets from other user who protect their tweets.

Description:
in your policy i see there is new domain add as in scope target , and the domain is niche.co .
there is some condition needed to success reproduce this vulnerability:

  1. the victim need to connect their twitter account with niche.co
  2. use the niche.co API to Access the Protected Tweets

Steps To Reproduce:

victim side

  • victim account is https://twitter.com/dummysystems
    • lets say the victim already set to protect his/her tweets via https://twitter.com/settings/safety
    • now when other user try to visit victim profile it will look like this
    • now visit https://www.niche.co/get-started and chose twitter , allow and or Authorize Niche to use your account and complete the rest (including confirming your email address).

attacker side

  1. attacker no need to have twitter account and or no need to have Niche account here , this made the severity is high
  2. just visit https://www.niche.co/api/v1/users/[victim_twitter_account] ( in this case the victim is https://www.niche.co/api/v1/users/dummysystems , the attacker will show some important information disclosure regarding the victim account
  3. scroll down the page till you see something like this /users/52667/posts?accounts=162059
  4. and open it, so the full URI will become https://www.niche.co/api/v1//users/52667/posts?accounts=162059
  5. and BOOM! the attacker now have Access to Protected Tweets from victim account.

noted
to follow the rules, I use my own account as the victim, so there is no other / real account has been compromised.

Regards,
